descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This course is exclusively available to School of Communication seniors admitted to the Creative Writing for the Media Module. The two course module sequence concludes in winter 2016 with Writers' Studio II.

The Creative Writing for the Media Module is designed to encourage mastery of the art and craft of writing for screen, stage, television and all forms of narrative media. Coursework nurtures development of personal vision within the context of a unique and diverse collective educational experience. Completion of the module will result in a portfolio of written work, pragmatic preparation for a post-graduation career path and vibrant respect for the inherent value of participation in a supportive community in all aspects of creative endeavor.      

For more information on the Creative Writing for the Media Module please visit:
https://society.northwestern.edu/node/1697/content/about
LEARNNG OBJECTIVES: This class is the first in a sequence of two intensive workshops culminating in winter 2017 with Writer's Studio II. This sequence is exclusively for School of Communication seniors who have been admitted to the Creative Writing for the Media Module.

During this quarter, students will focus on developing the intuitive and unconscious elements of the creative process with the goal of optimally synthesizing those elements with the more rational and conscious aspects of that process. They will then apply their mastery of the art and craft of narrative form toward significant progress on the full-length project section of their module requirements.

EVALUATION METHOD: Classes will be structured around lectures, discussions, reading assignments, viewing of selected films and clips, and workshop of student projects. Above all else, the classroom environment will be a supportive one and students will be encouraged to participate in a community marked by an atmosphere of collaboration.

Writing assignments are arranged to give fullest latitude to accommodate a variety of approaches to a writer's creative process starting with ideas and culminating in the successful and significant progress on the full-length project.

Evaluation will be based on final script material, class participation/professionalism and performance on Canvas Posts/Discussion Boards and writing assignments.

CLASS MATERIALS:

Required Textbooks:
? Howard, David (2004). How to Build a Great Screenplay, New York: St. Martin's Griffin;
? Pressfield, Stephen (2012). The War of Art, New York, Black Irish Entertainment
? Waldeback and Batty (2012) The Creative Screenwriter; Exercises to expand your craft. London. Bloomsbury, Methuen Drama.

Handouts distributed in class are required reading for the next session unless otherwise indicated.

Additional readings will be announced in class and posted on Canvas. These will be designated as required or optional.

Streamed films will be announced in class, posted and made available through links on Canvas. These films will be designated as required, optional or extra credit.
